poem:
"Persistency at Dawn"

In autumn's life, failure was her mentor,
A decade painted with the ink of rejections,
Still, she scribed with a resolute fervor.
A call from destiny broke her inscriptions,
One morning, an email holding not a dim 'but',
But the light of a dream's ignition.
Now at sixty-one, her quill doesn't rut,
Riding on the ink of determination.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "A new start after 60: after a decade of rejections, I got my first novel published. Now I’ve got my dream, I won’t stop! At 61, after a decade writing four unpublished manuscripts and receiving hundreds of rejections from agents and publishers, Melanie Cantor got an email in 2019 from the literary agent Felicity Blunt. “It started off positively and I was just waiting for the ‘but’ to arrive, but it never did,” Cantor says.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: A new start after 60: after a decade of rejections, I got my first novel published. Now I’ve got my dream, I won’t stop! At 61, after a decade writing four unpublished manuscripts and receiving hundreds of rejections from agents and publishers, Melanie Cantor got an email in 2019 from the literary agent Felicity Blunt. “It started off positively and I was just waiting for the ‘but’ to arrive, but it never did,” Cantor says.
